main event: On May 11, 1952, a bright blue object with a tail exploded over Seattle, causing a loud explosion and being witnessed by numerous individuals.
interesting points: The object was initially described as a vivid blue sphere that made a steep dive before exploding., Two local astronomers identified it as a meteor but searches for fragments were conducted., Witnesses reported a shock wave lasting approximately nine seconds after the explosion., The flash of light was seen and heard over a wide area, estimated to have been felt up to 50 miles away., The Air Force stated the object was not detected by radar, suggesting it may have been a meteor occurring at a lower altitude.
witness description: Many individuals across multiple city areas.
